data.title: Red Hot Chili Peppers: Setlist from 2024 Tour Kickoff
data.meta_description: Red Hot Chili Peppers kicked off their 2024 Unlimited Love North American tour last night (May 28) in Ridgefield, Washington.
data.text:
Red Hot Chili Peppers kicked off their 2024 Unlimited Love North American tour last night (May 28) in Ridgefield, Washington.

Per Setlist.fm, the band’s setlist contained 19 songs, including the two-song encore. The setlist offered a wide variety of tracks from the band’s catalog, including some of their biggest hist and songs from their 2022 albums Unlimited Love and Return of the Dream Canteen. (The full setlist is below.)

Red Hot Chili Peppers – 5/28/24 – Ridgefield, Washington – Setlist

“Intro Jam”

“Dani California”

“Scar Tissue”

“Aquatic Mouth Dance”

“Snow ((Hey Oh))”

“Eddie”

“Soul to Squeeze”

“Throw Away Your Television”

“Right on Time” (with the Clash’s “London Calling” intro)

“Whatchu Thinkin'”

“Tell Me Baby”

“Hey”

“Suck My Kiss”

“Californication”

“What Is Soul?” (Funkadelic cover)

“Black Summer”

“By the Way”

ENCORE

“I Could Have Lied”

“Give It Away”

Red Hot Chili Peppers 2024 Tour Dates

The Chili Peppers are headlining a variety of festivals in 2024, including the Innings Festival, Bonnaroo and the Harley-Davidson Homecoming Festival.

Another festival they’re headlining is Minnesota Yacht Club, a new festival taking place July 19-20 in Saint Paul, Minn. at Harriet Island Regional Park along the Mississippi River. The Chili Peppers are headlining the festival on July 20, while Gwen Stefani and Alanis Morissette headline on July 19. Also featured on the bill are The Black Crowes, The Offspring, Hippo Campus, Gary Clark Jr., Joan Jett & The Blackhearts, The Head and The Heart and more.

All festival dates are peppered (pun intended) into the band’s current slate of solo shows. A full list of current tour dates is also below.

5/31 – Quincy, WA – The Gorge +

Erica Banas is a news blogger who's been covering the rock/classic rock world since 2014. The coolest event she's ever covered in person was the 2021 Rock & Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony. (Sir Paul McCartney inducting Foo Fighters? C'mon now!) She's also well-versed in etiquette and extraordinarily nice. #TransRightsAreHumanRights
